Column Comment.0: STRATIGRAPHIC HIERARCHY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the hierarchy setthat is described. This column represents a denormalization of a parent table notactually created in PPDM. Only the table that describes the levels is defined.
Column Comment.1: HIERARCHY SEQUENCE NUMBER: A sequence number that orders hierarchytypes within the hierarchical description. For example, a chronostratigraphic hierarchymay be structured as Era (seq_no = 1) , Period (seq_no = 2), Series (seq_no =3),Stages (seq_no =- 4).
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.5: PARENT STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT TYPE: The parent type of stratigraphic unit. Forexample, the parent strat unit type of PERIOD may be ERA.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.7: REMARK: Narrative comments about this level in the stratigraphic hierarchy.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.9: SOURCE DOCUMENT: reference to the literature in which this level of the hierarchywas described.
Column Comment.10: STRATIGRAPHIC HIERARCHY TYPE: The type of hierarchy that is defined, such asbiostratigraphic (Era, Period, Series...) lithostratigraphic etc.
Column Comment.11: STRATIGRAPHIC HIERARCHY TYPE: The type of hierarchy that is defined, such asbiostratigraphic (Era, Period, Series...) lithostratigraphic etc.
Column Comment.12: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT TYPE: The type of stratigraphic unit, often described interms of its position in a hierarchical scale, such as Eon, Epoch, Bed, Formation etc.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
